Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Class SMTPConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connection
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.LineBasedConnection
        • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.SMTPConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, AuthenticateState, ConnectedState, HelloState, MailFromState, MessageEndState, MessageStartState, RecipientState, ResetState, SMTPConnectionMetadata
    public class SMTPConnection
extends LineBasedConnection
implements ConnectedState, HelloState, AuthenticateState, MailFromState, RecipientState, MessageStartState, MessageEndState, ResetState, SMTPConnectionMetadata
    Connection handler for the SMTP protocol. This manages one SMTP session over a TCP connection, handling command parsing, authentication, and message transfer according to RFC 5321.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • SMTPConnection

        protected SMTPConnection​(SMTPServer server,
                         java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
                         javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine,
                         boolean secure,
                         ClientConnected handler)
        Creates a new SMTP connection.
        Parameters:
        server - the SMTP server that created this connection
        channel - the socket channel for this connection
        engine - the SSL engine if this is a secure connection, null for plaintext
        secure - true if this connection should use TLS encryption
        handler - the application handler for SMTP events

      • receive

        public void receive​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)
        Invoked when application data is received from the client. The connection framework handles TLS decryption transparently, so this method receives plain SMTP protocol data. Routes data to appropriate handler based on current protocol state.
        Specified by:
        receive in class Connection
        Parameters:
        buf - the application data received from the client

      • continueLineProcessing

        protected boolean continueLineProcessing()
        Returns false when transitioning to DATA or BDAT mode to stop line processing.
        Overrides:
        continueLineProcessing in class LineBasedConnection
        Returns:
        true to continue processing lines, false to stop

      • lineReceived

        protected void lineReceived​(java.nio.ByteBuffer line)
        Called when a complete CRLF-terminated line has been received. Decodes the line and dispatches the command.

        Encoding handling per RFC 6531 (SMTPUTF8):

        • Before MAIL FROM: decode as US-ASCII, reject non-ASCII
        • MAIL FROM command: decode as UTF-8 (may contain internationalized address), then post-verify ASCII-only if SMTPUTF8 parameter was not specified
        • After MAIL FROM with SMTPUTF8: decode as UTF-8
        • After MAIL FROM without SMTPUTF8: decode as US-ASCII, reject non-ASCII
        Specified by:
        lineReceived in class LineBasedConnection
        Parameters:
        line - buffer containing the complete line including CRLF

      • getDSNEnvelopeParameters

        public DSNEnvelopeParameters getDSNEnvelopeParameters()
        Description copied from interface: SMTPConnectionMetadata
        Returns the DSN envelope parameters from the MAIL FROM command.

        These parameters indicate how the sender wants Delivery Status Notifications handled for this message:

        • RET - Whether to return the full message or just headers in DSNs
        • ENVID - An opaque envelope identifier for correlation
        Specified by:
        getDSNEnvelopeParameters in interface SMTPConnectionMetadata
        Returns:
        DSN envelope parameters, or null if none were specified
        See Also:
        DSNEnvelopeParameters

      • getDSNRecipientParameters

        public DSNRecipientParameters getDSNRecipientParameters​(EmailAddress recipient)
        Description copied from interface: SMTPConnectionMetadata
        Returns the DSN recipient parameters for a specific recipient.

        These parameters indicate when to send Delivery Status Notifications for this recipient:

        • NOTIFY - When to send DSNs (NEVER, SUCCESS, FAILURE, DELAY)
        • ORCPT - The original recipient address before any forwarding
        Specified by:
        getDSNRecipientParameters in interface SMTPConnectionMetadata
        Parameters:
        recipient - the recipient to get DSN parameters for
        Returns:
        DSN recipient parameters, or null if none were specified
        See Also:
        DSNRecipientParameters

      • isRequireTls

        public boolean isRequireTls()
        Description copied from interface: SMTPConnectionMetadata
        Returns whether REQUIRETLS was specified for this message.

        When true, the sender has indicated that this message must only be transmitted over TLS-protected connections (RFC 8689). If the server cannot guarantee TLS protection to the next hop during relay, the message should be bounced rather than delivered insecurely.

        Specified by:
        isRequireTls in interface SMTPConnectionMetadata
        Returns:
        true if REQUIRETLS was specified in MAIL FROM

      • acceptConnection

        public void acceptConnection​(java.lang.String greeting,
                             HelloHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedState
        Accepts the connection and sends a greeting banner.

        Sends a 220 response to the client with the specified greeting message and transitions to the hello state where HELO/EHLO commands are expected.

        The greeting message typically includes the server hostname and optionally indicates ESMTP support. For example: 

         "mail.example.com ESMTP Service ready"
        Specified by:
        acceptConnection in interface ConnectedState
        Parameters:
        greeting - the greeting text to send (without the 220 code)
        handler - receives the client's HELO/EHLO command

      • rejectConnection

        public void rejectConnection()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedState
        Rejects the connection with a default message.

        Sends a 554 response and closes the connection. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

        Specified by:
        rejectConnection in interface ConnectedState

      • rejectConnection

        public void rejectConnection​(java.lang.String message)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedState
        Rejects the connection with a custom message.

        Sends a 554 response with the specified message and closes the connection. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

        Specified by:
        rejectConnection in interface ConnectedState
        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message (without the 554 code)

      • acceptHello

        public void acceptHello​(MailFromHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: HelloState
        Accepts the greeting and transitions to mail-from state.

        For EHLO, sends a 250 multi-line response advertising available extensions (SIZE, STARTTLS, AUTH, PIPELINING, etc.). For HELO, sends a simple 250 response.

        Specified by:
        acceptHello in interface HelloState
        Parameters:
        handler - receives subsequent MAIL FROM commands

        public void rejectHelloTemporary​(java.lang.String message,
                                 HelloHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: HelloState
        Temporarily rejects the greeting (allow retry).

        Sends a 421 response. The client may retry the greeting.

        Specified by:

      • acceptMessage

        public void acceptMessage​(MessageDataHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: MessageStartState
        Ready to receive message content.

        For DATA, sends 354 response. For BDAT, processing begins immediately. Message bytes are written to the pipeline's channel if one was provided via MailFromHandler.getPipeline().

        The handler receives completion notification via MessageDataHandler.messageComplete(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.MessageEndState).

        Specified by:
        acceptMessage in interface MessageStartState
        Parameters:
        handler - receives message completion notification

        Description copied from interface: MessageEndState

        Used when the message cannot be accepted right now but might be acceptable later (e.g., downstream server unavailable).
